title: Toowoomba girl left hanging by cord of a DRAWSTRING HAT | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 16 shares A line of terrifying rope burn could be seen cutting across the Year One student's throat. 'It looks like her throat's been slit,' the girl's mother, who asked to remain anonymous, told the Sunshine Coast Daily . The mother said that her daughter luckily suffered no damage to her vocal chords, but was told by doctors that she could have easily broken her neck in the accident. 'It is a death waiting to happen,' the mother added. 'To pick your child up from school and know she has almost hung herself is horrible.' The mother said her daughter has been traumatised by the incident, which she believes was completely preventable. Now she's arguing that the broad-brimmed hat, which is part of her daughter's compulsory school uniform, is 'unacceptable' for children. The girl's mother is now fighting to have the broad-brimmed hats replaced with cords that have quick-release clips on them (stock image) The mother said she had concerns when she first purchased the hat and saw the dangling cord, but decided it must be safe if it was part of a school uniform. She has since suggested to the school's principal that quick-release hats be made compulsory for the uniform instead. Quick-release hats have a clip-on that will cause the string of the hat to release under a small amount of pressure, Kidsafe Queensland CEO Susan Teerds explained. 'We know that a drawstring around a child's neck can be a hazard so we need to do anything we can to make it safer,' she said. 'One injury is one injury too many - and children could even die from this.' Read more: Share or comment on this article 16
